intro: Acosta castellana, commonly known as the Castilian acosta, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, powdery coating. Acosta castellana is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
